title: Though, Although, Despite, In Spite Of, And However

questions.question: We went out .......................... the rain.
questions.description: Despite and in spite of are interchangeable.

questions.question: She passed the test ............................... having a bad teacher.
questions.description: Although is a conjunction and despite is a preposition. As a preposition, despite can be followed by a noun or an ing form.

questions.question: She passed the test .......................... she had a bad teacher.
questions.description: Although is a conjunction. It should be followed by a clause.

questions.question: ....................... I had a headache, I enjoyed the party very much.
It was a good restaurant, ......................... expensive.
The train was late ..................... I managed to arrive on time.
questions.description: However is a transitional adverb. It cannot connect two clauses. It goes at the beginning of a clause expressing an idea that contrasts with the previous clause.

questions.question: ........................... the train was late, I managed to reach on time.
questions.description: Although is a conjunction. It should be followed by a clause.

questions.question: They managed to finish the job .......................... there was no one to help them.
questions.description: Though and although are conjunctions used to connect two clauses.

questions.question: They finished the job ..................... the fact that they had no one to help them.
questions.description: Despite and in spite of are interchangeable. They are prepositions and can be followed by the expression 'the fact that'.
answers: Either despite or in spite of

questions.question: ................................ tired, he went on working.
questions.description: Though is a conjunction. It can connect two clauses.

questions.question: ........................ hard I tried, I could not solve the puzzle.
........................ trying hard, I could not solve the puzzle.
questions.description: Despite can be followed by a noun or ing form.
